title: How to communicate efficiently with teammate?
body:
Just played 2 games where it's more than possible to win.

Game 1.
Enemy keep backdooring our open Inhibitor, over, and over, and over, and over, and over again.
Unable to get another teammate to ward, nor can I get them to stay in base. 
Even when I did manage to get one to agree to stay, he'll somehow push out til Golem camp and allow an enemy champion to just slip in and take the inhib... 

The game lasted 53 minutes with myself wearing myself running around CCing backdoorers, pinging enemies that was spotted by my wards, warding, homeguarding, recalling... One of the most tiring game I've ever played.

We spot them doing baron, scare them off, and suddenly 3 of us decided that they want baron and ignore my backpings... Enemy Lucian walk in like he own our base and took out our open nexus.


We have much stronger teamfighting, and can win all the 5v5s, it's just that after a fight, they'll push ahead and allow a lone survivor on enemy team to take inhib... The game was very winnable.

Times like these makes me really miss S3, where I could literally sprinkle wards all over the map and could inform my teammate of incoming backdooring much effeciently, having to share the warding duty means... There's only 3 wards on the map... My wards.


Game 2.
Enemy had Rengar, Fiora and Naut to lock down our Vayne.
our WW, Leona, Lee Sin keep diving on Yasuo who WW cc, leaving me, a Ziggs to solo peel for Vayne against the 3 mentioned above.

The same thing happen nearly 6 times over with me mentioning they need to peel instead of engage...

I simply could not get them to stop diving, after witnessing the horror of them diving 3 straight times, I call for surrender, I accepted the fact that I will never be able to stop them from engaging instead of peeling... It took another 3 fights before they realize they actually won't peel and will eventually lose the game, and surrendered.


**Question....
How exactly do you communicate with players like those effectively? Without having to start insulting their mothers to get their attention? (I didn't, I was damn near about to try it to see if it'll work)**

replies.body: You haven't mentioned if they replied to anything you said. Maybe you're over exaggerating a little.

They don't type crap.

something like this.
"We need to ward, they'll back door"
-complete silence-
"They'll backdoor, one stay, one stay"
"I'll stay"
- Proceed to push and lose an inhib
"You freaking let them slip pass you like nothing!"
"Stfu, fuck you"

The rest of the game are basically
"D base, D base"
"Don't leave, don't leave"
"GJ, they took another inhib"
*Ping back when they're too far from base*
*Try to stop enemy Wukong hitting our inhib as I slow him down with my Nami*
Inhib goes down, start lamenting over how we have to stay in base for another 4~5 minutes til all inhib up or they'll kill our naked Nexus.
Place pink wards at fallen Inhib.

*Continue to ping, give instruction to defend base*
-No reply whatsoever with them sometimes listen, and most of the time, not.

Pings only worked when I ping someone trying to backdoor via jungle route, where they'll respond, otherwise, they ignore all instruction.
*Spotted by my ward in Purple Side, top of Red buff and Purple side, the cross road between Wolves and Blue camp.


For game 2.
Me "We need to peel, they have Fiora and Rengar"
WW "Get Yasuo" *Flash and ult, Lee and Leona follow up with their cc*
Lamenting as I see Naut ult on Vayne while Fiora turn in from another corner, and Rengar probably already invisible.
*Tries but fail to protect Vayne, somehow win that fight with only Lee and Leona alive*

After the fight.
Me "We needed to peel, not engage"
Vayne "Who cares we win that fight"
*Lamenting over how we could've gotten an inhib or baron if we had Vayne alive after that fight.*


The next fight, exactly the same except we got ace as Vayne don't have summoner's and I don't have summoner heal to delay her and my death which allowed us to put more hurt on the 3 that dove us.
"We need to peel for Vayne or she will die, we can't win like this"
Leona "Shut up"
Vayne "You're just pissed because you die" ***
Me "No, I'm pissed because you die, because the entire team but me neglected you"


*** I cannot for the life of me understands why Vayne is on their side

Another similar fail fight, throw in /ff. "Not like you guys will ever peel", majority vote no. " I've played far too many games like these already and is dead-certain that we have no chance winning.


Instant replay 3 more fights where we get aced harder and harder, then they agree to finally forfeit.



The above is as accurate as I can put it.
I really wonder what else I could do to get them to work together.


EDIT: When I said lamenting over, it's basically me getting more and more frustrated behind my screen asking saying out loud "Why?" while frustrated, as well as thinking about 

"what could have been if the team played those out properly, more objectives and better chance to win"

Sounds like you're typing a little too much. 
Only advice I have is ping about 5 times if you want anyone to notice(its much more effective than pinging once), and don't bother typing more than a couple messages trying to explain things. If they're not getting the message by then, they probably still wont after 10 more messages and all you'll achieve is to distract yourself from the game and often end up making people pissed off at you or each other. 

Sounds like you tilt a bit too, just focus on what YOU can do to win the game and don't worry so much about your team. Sure, sometimes your team are idiots and you lose a perfectly winnable game, that's just how it is. Just as often (even though you probably don't notice it) your enemies are idiots too and you'll win games you shouldn't, it evens out.

Hmm, sounds like they are pre-made or something. Otherwise, you just have pretty greedy team. I've used communication many times whenever I'm in a match and they seemed to listen to everything I say... except when I'm alone with a 3 or 4 pre-made. Have you tried Triple Pinging? Pinging 3 times to everything? It works for me.

>Triple Pinging? Pinging 3 times to everything? It works for me.

May i say, fuck you.

I hate people who do this for everything and just end up being annoying as fuck.
Annoying or not, it IS more effective

Hardly, if someone isn't listening to pings, they aren't more likely to listen the third time.

I in fact mute pings if shit like that happens, and have in normals just actively gone against pings that are just being spammed at me.

Pissing someone off doesn't help anything.

Because you can tell people what they should do when they disagree with something
I've never seen anyone pissed off about pinging 3 times.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kxMCYNmiLZE

This is something that basically applies, fact is if the person isn't willing to listen, it ain't gonna happen.

Games like these happen, just focus on getting better YOURSELF, not much you can do when no one will listen to a decent call.

They probably thought better then you, in their opinion anyway. Try not to be demanding of them as they will get a) sulky and petulant or b) shut you out and do their own thing.

Another issue is that even though you could see the bigger picture of what was going in the game, why do your teamates have no knowledge of game meta?
To communicate this you may need to take time to explain why they are doing the wrong thing, they seem too focused on progressing and not defending in the first case or playing hotheaded in the second and from what I can scrounge up they don't really care if they win or not. 
They just want their scores to look good.
